meanings.definition: A written account of something that has happened.
meanings.sent1: I keep a record of all the books I have read.
meanings.sent2: The record for the longest jump was broken yesterday.
meanings.sent3: My dog tried to eat my homework, leaving teeth marks all over the record.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, a record of her joy.
meanings.sent5: The record of his kindness will always be remembered.

meanings.definition: The best performance or achievement in a particular sport or activity.
meanings.sent1: She holds the record for the fastest sprint in our school.
meanings.sent2: Breaking the world record in swimming is a dream for many athletes.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel set a new record for acorn gathering in the park.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his craft set a new record for excellence.
meanings.sent5: The record of her dance routine left the audience in awe.

meanings.definition: To set down in writing or some other permanent form for later reference.
meanings.sent1: I will record the meeting minutes for everyone to review.
meanings.sent2: She likes to record her thoughts in a journal every night.
meanings.sent3: The parrot learned to record a few words after hearing them repeatedly.
meanings.sent4: His smile was recorded in the family album for future generations to see.
meanings.sent5: The artist decided to record the beauty of the sunset on canvas.
